pages.text: Vampirism is a terrible $(l:bewitchment:curses/conducting_curses)Curse$() that most consider terminal. $(br2)$(l:bewitchment:creatures/vampire)Vampires$() are technically immortal, though their immortality feeds on the blood of humans; without it, they die.$(br2)Vampires have a small bonus to movement speed and attack damage. Additionally, they are weak to $(l:bewitchment:introduction/silver)Silver$() and $(l:bewitchment:introduction/crops)Garlic$().

Vampirism cannot be cast with a $(l:bewitchment:tools/brazier)Brazier$(); instead, it has to be contracted from another $(l:bewitchment:creatures/vampire)Vampire$().$(br2)To contract the $(l:bewitchment:curses/conducting_curses)Curse$(), one must be under the $(l:bewitchment:curses/conducting_curses)Curse$() of $(l:bewitchment:curses/susceptibility)Susceptibility$() and be slain by a $(l:bewitchment:creatures/vampire)Vampire$()... but $(l:bewitchment:poppets/death_protection)Still Survive$().$(br2)$(o)But why would you want this?$()
